moves.1. c4 Nf6 2. Nf3 e6 3. Nc3 d5 4. e3 Be7: So we get a Queens Indian in a roundabout way.
moves.7. O-O Bb7 8. Bd2 Nbd7 9. Rc1 dxc4 10. B: This "robert_a1777" had already beaten me in a close game just before this one, and now he's got me in what I judge an already slightly inferior position, only 16 moves in! ...This crap is ticking me off, folks. ;-)
moves.16... Qa7 17. b4 Nce4 18. Bb1 Rac8 19. N: ?! -- Better was 19. ...Be4, after which 20. Be4? Ne4 puts a monster in the middle of White's position.
moves.20. Bxe4: ! -- Gotta get rid of that bad boy!
moves.20... Bxe4 21. Rxc8 Rxc8 22. Rc1 Rxc1+ 2: ?! -- ...I still don't know what this move was supposed to do.
moves.29. g5 Bg7 30. Kh2 Kf8 31. Kg1 Ke7 32. K: ? -- Pfff! Anti-positional: the long diagonal is much better for Black's QB.
moves.40... fxe5 41. Bb2 Bd5: ? -- Black hands White counterplay. Nastier was 41. ...Be6 with the threat of ...Qg4.
moves.42. Qc3+ Kd6 43. Qc5+ Ke6 44. Qc8+: ! -- Secures the draw. There's no shelter from the storm of Black checks.
I might have searched for a possible win 'long about here, but I was desperately short of time; so short that even repeating moves wasn't giving me enough back on the increment.
moves.48. Qd8+ Kf7 49. Qd7+ Kf6 50. Qd8+ Kf7 5: White claimed a draw by repetition. - 1/2-1/2
